accountHelp.message:
Manage account

Connect to the iDoneThis account to which you want to send your done tasks. The token you provide is stored locally, and is used for sending your dones to iDoneThis.

When connected, this space shows the account name in use.

On 'Disconnect', your iDoneThis token, and all related user data stored locally are removed permanently. You will need to connect again to use the extension.
accountHelp.description: Help text for account section of settings

teamsSectionHelp.message:
Manage teams

Displays the current default team to which your done tasks are added.

You can change the default team from the dropdown list. You can also change the team for a specific task from the task popup by clicking on the current team name.

If you recently joined or created a new team and don't see it in the list, update the list using the 'Refresh team list' button.
teamsSectionHelp.description: Help text for teamsSection section of settings

donesSectionHelp.message:
Sync Settings

Specify how frequently to check for new dones on iDoneThis servers.

To stop syncing completely, set the value to 0.

This setting doesn't impact sending dones to iDoneThis using this extension.
donesSectionHelp.description: Help text for donesSection section of settings

feedbackSectionHelp.message: I really would like to hear your feedback - feature suggestions, bug reports, ideas, and complaints. Please share using this link!
feedbackSectionHelp.description: Help text for feedbackSection section of settings

meHelp.message:
Hi!

I'm Adi, the ideator, instigator and developer behind this extension.

I am...

  • an engineer and an MBA by education,
  • a management consultant by what I've done longest,
  • a runner-cycist-swimmer-hiker by what I enjoy,
  • and too much of a dog person, according to most dogs.

I also like staying (loosely) in touch with those old programming skills I learnt in undergrad over a decade back. So, in my spare time, I develop extensions and apps for Chrome - mainly around some need I have or, in one case, a need that @Zee had.

Catch me on Twitter (@adityabhaskar) if you've got any feedback, or just want to chat.

I'm also at @middlering, if you want to talk about running, cycling, swimming, hiking, or not loving your dog too much.

Cheers!
meHelp.description: Help text for me section of settings
